title: Phoenix police: Woman playing with AK-47 kills boyfriend
content:
A 25-year-old woman is accused of shooting her boyfriend in the face while messing around with his AK-47 at a Phoenix motel.
Gabriella Marie Dolore Orona Hardee was arrested on suspicion of negligent homicide and was being held Friday in a Maricopa County jail in lieu of a $100,000 bond, court records show.
Hardee, boyfriend Rosario Soto Leon and three other people had stayed overnight at a Motel 6 in west Phoenix and were about to check out at noon Thursday when the shooting occurred.
Phoenix police say Soto Leon was lying on his back next to the rifle when Hardee got on the bed, straddled him and picked up the firearm.
Holding the weapon with both hands, "she pointed the gun at a downward angle that was directly at Rosario's head," according to a police statement. "She had her finger on the trigger and believed that (if) she didn't squeeze the trigger, it would not discharge."
But it did discharge, shooting Soto Leon in the face. Police said in court records that the killing was accidental, a result of Hardee "carelessly" operating the AK-47.
Hardee turned herself in to police at the motel, near 51st Avenue and McDowell Road.
Her next court hearing is set for Aug. 18 in Maricopa County Superior Court.
